DOCNAME: CASE OF KEŠELJ AND OTHERS v. MONTENEGRO
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants and the debtor ( ORG “ PERSON ) reached a court approved settlement before ORG , whereby the debtor undertook to pay the applicants specified amounts in respect of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . NORP The settlement became final on the same date .
CARDINAL . The debtor ultimately paid part of the amounts determined in the settlement .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened insolvency proceedings against the debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants submitted their respective claims based on the settlement .
CARDINAL . In the course of the insolvency proceedings ORG acknowledged the ORG claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated ( zaključio ) the insolvency proceedings against the debtor , but continued the proceedings against the debtor ’s estate . This decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ constitutional appeal on procedural grounds .
CARDINAL . The court settlement in question remains partly unenforced to the present day .

CARDINAL . It transpires from the case file that at the time the court settlement was concluded and became final ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL above ) the debtor was a company predominantly comprised of NORP capital . The Government neither contested this nor provided any evidence to the contrary .
